title: Creo Parametric 7.0: Introduction to Mechanism Design
author: Ascent, Center for Technical Knowledge
description: A comprehensive guide to mechanism design using Creo Parametric 7.0, providing essential tools for creating and analyzing mechanisms.

title: Bali in the 1930's
author: Arthur Fleischmann
description: A photographic and narrative exploration of life in Bali during the 1930s, capturing the essence of the island's culture and society.

title: The Fight to Vote
author: Michael Waldman
description: The history of the fight for voting rights in the United States, tracing key moments and challenges faced by marginalized groups in gaining suffrage.

title: The Glory of Batik
author: Judi Achjadi
description: An exploration of batik as an Indonesian cultural heritage, showcasing its history, artistry, and significance in traditional and modern contexts.

title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
author: Douglas Crockford
description: A concise guide to the most elegant and powerful features of JavaScript, focusing on the language's best practices and avoiding its pitfalls.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A set of principles and practices for writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code, emphasizing readability and simplicity.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: Practical strategies for building and maintaining good habits, and breaking bad ones, with a focus on small, incremental changes.

title: Design Patterns
author: Erich Gamma, et al.
description: A catalog of common design patterns in object-oriented software development, offering reusable solutions for recurring design challenges.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
description: A comparison of two different mindsets on money and investing, offering insights into personal finance, wealth building, and financial independence.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andy Hunt, Dave Thomas
description: Practical advice and best practices for professional software developers, covering topics from project management to effective coding techniques.

title: Start with Why
author: Simon Sinek
description: Inspiring leadership by understanding and communicating the 'why' behind actions, focusing on purpose and vision to create lasting impact.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping history of humankind, tracing our origins, evolution, and development from the earliest ancestors to the present day.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A guide to the lean startup methodology, focusing on building businesses efficiently with iterative development and customer feedback.
